text:
As I mentioned in #188

When we see `realms` we would know that it is a list, and when we see `realm` we would know that is a string.

In this case, we kept `request.realm` as the space-separated string, and add a `request.realms` as the list one.
title: Realms vs realm

text:

When we see `realms` we would know that it is a list, and when we see `realm` we would know that is a string.

title: Realms vs realm
Pull request merge from lepture/oauthlib:realms to idan/oauthlib:master

text: Great initiative. Keeping the list called realms will be much less confusing. Don't hesitate to point out similar things in the rest of the new provider code :)
use realms as the list container, realm as the string container
